alert.note: Alert for Eastern Clay; Western Clay (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 6:12PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN ST. JOHNS...NORTHEASTERN PUTNAM AND SOUTHEASTERN CLAY COUNTIES THROUGH 715 PM EDT... At 612 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms over Bardin, or 9 miles northwest of Palatka, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph, pea size hail, and excessive cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Excessive cloud-to-ground lightning is occurring. Locations impacted include... Saint Augustine, Hastings, Saint Augustine Beach, George`s Lake, Vilano Beach, Picolata, Bostwick, Federal Point, Saint Augustine Shores, and Butler Beach. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
